Posts.Title: surgery chris1959 PattyPeppermint

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2014 05:56AM - edited Jan 6, 2014 05:57AM by MsTee I do exactly what Pajim does! I listen for the music in the clanks and whirs…I used to DJ electronic music, so I find myself bringing string fills and trying to layer on more sounds. I also try to keep my eyes shut, as the top of the tube is much closer to my face than I'd like. The hardest part for me is the 24 hour clock the imaging dept runs on. I had one Friday morning at 3:45 am. No matter what your sleep schedule is, that messes it up. I hope your results are good!
Posts.Title: Question re: First of three (3!) MRIs tomorrow. Tina2 sandilee

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2016 11:00PM - edited Jul 4, 2016 11:00PM by MsTee Shetlandpony - I've not used affinitor yet. What makes it not easy? The biggest challenges I've had with the GDC-0032 have been digestive: rapid transit, diarrhea and difficulty eating as much raw veg as I like. Happy to answer any questions or speak to specifics?
Posts.Title: How are people with liver mets doing? blondie1 JFL

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2016 05:35AM MsTee wrote: 18 months ago liver mets popped up and I had to change my treatment. I went on a trial (GDC-0032 + letrozole) and the mets went quiet. They're not even showing on the scans anymore (if the rest of the mets/tumours would just follow suit!:) ) I kind of lost my taste for alcohol...which might just be me listening to my body and my liver saying nope. Since I'm on a trial I have to really limit supplements. I switched from predominantly oral painkillers to a fentanyl patch (although I still use hydromorphone as a breakthrough). Never discount lots of water to flush the liver when you can't have things like milk thistle! :)
Posts.Title: How are people with liver mets doing? blondie1 JFL

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2016 10:57PM - edited Jul 4, 2016 11:02PM by MsTee Zarovka, it's like you read minds. :) I'm in a phase 1 trial for GDC-0032 in combo with Letrozole. I'm coming up on 18 months. It has some issues but doesn't everything? Overall, pretty tolerable, just digestive issues, mostly. Rapid bowel transit, bad stomach...not unbearable I just had to pause for rads because I've had some lymph node growth (to an existing tumour), but no spreading since I started the trial. I restart in a couple days.
Posts.Title: How are people with liver mets doing? blondie1 JFL
